notesStmt.note: Detached corner ornament contained in curatorial file
A number of folios have been excised
Remains of paper pastedowns on staves
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2033, no. 48.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 16, no. 12.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript – made in Italy around 1500 – contains Antiphons from the Vigil of the Nativity to the Nativity of the Virgin (fols. 1r-68v), as well as additional liturgical texts appended at a later date (fols. 69r-75v). Both sections are accompanied by musical notation on four-line staves. A number of folios (at least fifteen) have been excised from the main text, leaving it imperfect. An original index on fol. 1v indicates the extent of this manuscript's original contents. Along with the original foliation in red ink, this would have facilitated easy reference to the required text. There are ten large illuminated initials on fols. 2r, 3v, 4v, 6r, 8r, 43r, 45v, 49v, 53v, and 61v, as well as numerous black and colored initials – some with penwork decoration – throughout the rest of the book.

msItem.title: Antiphonary, from the Vigil of the Nativity to
Additional texts, for the feast of Our Lady of Victory(?) [fols. 68r-75r] and for Our Lady of Sorrows(?) [fol. 75v]

supportDesc.extent: 75; 570 x 386 mm bound to 590 x 420 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Early foliation in red ink, right recto; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

layoutDesc.layout: One column of five lines; four-line staves with musical notation in red ink; ruled in red ink; evidence of pricking; written area: 430 x 300 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Ten illuminated initials; numerous black and colored initials with pen-work decoration

binding.p: Stamped Russian leather over wooden boards; brass corner ornaments; one clasp, remains of another

history.provenance: Thomas F. Richardson, Boston (lot 48 in his 1919 sale); John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
